parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the tie rod end joints can cause loss of steering control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Excessive vertical play in the tie rod end joints
resulting in loss of steering control
making the vehicle unsafe to operate at highway speeds.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A defect in the steering system can cause loss of steering control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Vehicle feels light in the front end
wanders or drifts on the road
especially in windy or bumpy conditions
and is sensitive to truck blasts or other external forces.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tire tread separation can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially fatal consequences, especially when traveling at high speeds.
Steel rim failure can cause tire blowouts, loss of control, and accidents, posing a significant risk to the driver, passengers, and other road users.
symptoms: Hub caps coming loose or falling off
rims cracking and failing at the welded point

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Defective hub caps can come loose and fall off while driving, causing a road hazard and potentially leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Hub caps coming loose or falling off
and refusal by the manufacturer to acknowledge the defect.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake system failure can cause accidents, injuries, and fatalities, especially when traveling at high speeds.
The severe vibration and shaking of the vehicle can cause loss of control, leading to accidents, and can also lead to premature wear of components, affecting vehicle performance and safety.
symptoms: The vehicle severely shakes and vibrates while driving
the vibration appears to come from the front end of the vehicle
the vehicle tilts sideways while driving.
